Global Business Environment

The aim of this module is to introduce students to fundamental aspect of the external global business context, providing a strong grounding of theory and knowledge, and enabling students to understand business-related political, economic, social and technological news stories and developments, as they occur through their degree study period. The major focus of the module will be on fundamental economic concepts and their applications. In addition, the impact of macro level external environmental factors on companies’ domestic operations and their international expansion strategies will be considered. Students will be able to engage with contemporary developments, understanding their causes and impacts. Further, it is hoped that student interest in these areas will be piqued such that they are active throughout their studies in engaging with global political and economic developments, and critique their effect on global businesses.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate a critical understanding of microeconomic concepts and their influence on businesses.

+  Critically analyse key business trends and developments in recent years from a political; economic; societal and technological perspectives.

+  Demonstrate a critical understanding of the workings of the macro-economy and its interaction with the global econom.y

+  Critically evaluate the theoretical parameters within which international businesses operate, and analyse and recommend business developmental opportunities.

+  Assess, communicate and report upon international business opportunities.
